She submitted , in particular , that PERSON had disappeared in life - threatening circumstances , that DATE had elapsed since his disappearance and that , given the situation in GPE , there were grounds to believe that he had been killed following his abduction .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the second applicant 's claim . The court 's reasoning , in its relevant parts , was as follows :
“ [ The court ] obtained copies of materials from criminal case file [ no . DATE ] .

From the decision of DATE to institute criminal proceedings it transpires that on DATE CARDINAL unidentified men in camouflage uniforms , armed with automatic weapons , arrived at the entrance to the [ ORG ] building in a dark blue VAZ-CARDINAL vehicle without licence plates and took PERSON , born in DATE , by force to an unknown destination from the secure grounds of the [ ORG ] ; [ PERSON ] whereabouts remain unknown .

From the transcripts of the interview of the deputy Minister of the Interior of GPE , PERSON . , dated DATE ; the head of the Groznenskiy ROVD , Mr S. , dated DATE ; the acting head of the NORP police office , Mr Sh . , dated DATE , and the then acting Minister of the Interior , Mr NORP , dated DATE , it follows that [ PERSON ] had been taken away with their knowledge [ с их ведома ] and , most likely , by officials of the power structures . Hence , the court finds no reasons to believe that [ PERSON ] could have perished during his abduction and is not alive .
Thus , DATE when there was information on [ PERSON ] whereabouts is DATE . The DATE term has not expired .

However , under LAW , a citizen may be declared dead if in his place of residence there has been no information on his whereabouts for DATE ; if he has gone missing in life - threatening circumstances or there are grounds to believe that he has died as a result of an accident [ a citizen may be declared dead ] within DATE .

The court is not in possession of any information that [ Bekman Asadulayev ] went missing in life - threatening circumstances , as a consequence of which his death could be presumed , because he was taken away from secure grounds to which no person has access without a proper pass . ”
CARDINAL . There is no indication that the second applicant challenged the ORG judgment on appeal .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW Procedure DATE ( “ ORG ” ) provides that an investigator 's or prosecutor 's decision to refuse to institute criminal proceedings or to terminate a case , and other orders and acts or omissions which are liable to infringe the constitutional rights and freedoms of the parties to criminal proceedings or to impede a citizen 's access to justice may be appealed against to a local district court , which is empowered to examine the lawfulness and grounds of the impugned decisions .

CARDINAL . LAW ORG prohibits the disclosure of information from the preliminary investigation file . Under part CARDINAL of the LAW , information from the investigation file may be divulged only with the permission of a prosecutor or investigator and only in so far as it does not infringe the rights and lawful interests of the parties to the criminal proceedings or prejudice the investigation . Divulging information about the private lives of parties to criminal proceedings without their permission is prohibited .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the NORP Civil Code provides that damage sustained by an individual because of unlawful actions or inaction of ORG and municipal agencies or their officials is to be compensated for by a ORG or municipal treasury .
